Compound growth
--------------------------------------------

TODO: Figure

The value of an asset compounding at rate $r(t)$ per day is

$$ a(t) = a(t_{1}) \prod_{t=1}^{T} \left( 1 + r(t) \right) $$

The Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR), using the sampling frequency
of $\ell=252$ trading days per year, is

$$ r_\mathrm{CAGR}(t) = \left( \frac{a(t)}{a(t_{1})} \right)^{\frac{\ell}{t}} - 1 $$
